result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany L. Schmid

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of the 1/15/15 Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together at 9:57 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement on 13CM440; Atty De La Rosa submits plea paperwork

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#2-14CF46 & Cts #1, #2 & #3-13CM206 & Ct#1-13CM440 & Ct#1-13CM438; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses #14CF48-Ct#1 as amended to reflect delivery of Imitation Controlled substance (on/Near Park) contrary to 961.41(4)(am)a and Count #2, a Cass I felony AND remaining counts in 13CM206
Sentencing arguments by Counsel; Statements by Ms. Schmid

On Ct#2-14CF46, the Court sentences Ms. Schmid to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 and one half years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 132 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses (not less than 2x/mth for the 1st six months upon release from prison)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with Roger Molter
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $325 drug testing fee ($125 joint & several with Roger Molter)
--To pay $260 buy money reimbursement ($100 joint & several with Roger Molter)
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

No suspension of driving privileges
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

On Cts #1, #2 & #3-13CM206 & Ct#1-13CM440 & Ct#1-13CM438, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, to commence concurrent to one another and concurrent to 14CF46
--132 days credit for time already served given
-13CM438 & Ct#1-13CM440
--133 days credit for time already served given-13CM206 
--pay costs of $1215 ($243 each count) + $1000 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count) = $2215 due today; alternate resu.lts in entry of civil judgment against Defendant in favor of Jefferson County
Recess: 10:47 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together 2:13 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Do not have resolution yet, but not due to lack of effort. Are close to resolution, but the State needs some more time to get some final chemical testing done on ceased evidence, which may impact recommendation in these matters. Requests additional STC in 30 days.
DA Happ: Agreed, hoping 30 days will be enough time to get results back. If set for plea/sentencing, may move the lab along quicker.
Atty De La Rosa: No objection
Court continues bond
Recess: 2:16 pm 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing 1/15/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together at 10:09 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid appears via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa, who appears in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Have criminal case settlement offers on each case, but do not yet have resolution, but do believe resolution will be reached. Request matters be set for STC & possible plea/sentencing in 3 - 4 weeks.
ADA Hall: Requests all matters also be set for jury trial, presents basis
Court informs parties that It will not set trial dates at this time, but if at next hearing cases do not resolve - all cases will be set for trial at that time
Recess: 10:13 am 

NEXT: ALL FILES: (1) Schedule STC (possible Plea/Sentencing) 12/11/14 at 2:00 pm (1 hour) - Send notices
Status conference on November 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together at 10:33 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Requests matter be set for STC, presents basis including further negotiations needed
ADA Hall: No objection
Court orders bond remain as fixed
Recess: 10:34 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule STC 11/17/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices
State's (with cover letter)
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Status conference on October 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 1, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's
Scheduling Notice

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together at 8:38 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa submits Discovery Demands on cases 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48

14CF46 & 14CF48:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Schmid waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

As to all cases, Atty De La Rosa requests DA PTC & STC be set
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of release remain in effect while cases are pending
Recess: 8:46 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 10/1/14 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/24/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
TO COVER FILES 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48

Cases 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48 called together at 2:03 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tiffany L. Schmid appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty De La Rosa indicates that he has no argument regarding non-appearance in 13CM206

13CM438, 13CM440, 14CF46 & 14CF48:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited in CF cases

Court requires a $3000 CASH bond, to cover ALL cases, with conditions: 
-No contact with Jaclyn Pardue, Sally Leis or Jacy Zurheide, Nicole Magsamen, Paul Bradow, Roger Molter
-No possession or use of any financial cards not in her own name
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia to include syringes
-No presence at  Breslow's Market

Plea of "not guilty" entered on 13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
14CF46 & 14CF48; Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties, but defense requests prelim. in 20 days

NEXT: 14CF46 & 14CF48: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 9/19/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices 
13CM206, 13CM438, 13CM440 (1) Schedule STC 9/19/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
